metadata.title: CVE-2021-46947 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: sfc:adjust efx->xdp_tx_queue_count with the real number of initialized queuesefx->xdp_tx_queue_count is initially initialized to num_possible_cpus() andis later used to allocate and traverse efx->xdp_tx_queues lookup array.However, we may end up not initializing all the array slots with realqueues during probing. This results, for example, in a NULL pointerdereference, when running "# ethtool -S <iface>", similar to below[2570283.664955][T4126959] BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference, address:00000000000000f8 [2570283.681283][T4126959] #PF: supervisor read access inkernel mode [2570283.695678][T4126959] #PF: error_code(0x0000) -not-present page [2570283.710013][T4126959] PGD 0 P4D 0[2570283.721649][T4126959] Oops: 0000 [#1] SMP PTI[2570283.734108][T4126959] CPU: 23 PID: 4126959 Comm: ethtool Tainted: G O5.10.20-cloudflare-2021.3.1 #1 [2570283.752641][T4126959] Hardware name:<redacted> [2570283.781408][T4126959] RIP:0010:efx_ethtool_get_stats+0x2ca/0x330 [sfc] [2570283.796073][T4126959]Code: 00 85 c0 74 39 48 8b 95 a8 0f 00 00 48 85 d2 74 2d 31 c0 eb 07 48 8b95 a8 0f 00 00 48 63 c8 49 83 c4 08 83 c0 01 48 8b 14 ca <48> 8b 92 f8 0000 00 49 89 54 24 f8 39 85 a0 0f 00 00 77 d7 48 8b[2570283.831259][T4126959] RSP: 0018:ffffb79a77657ce8 EFLAGS: 00010202[2570283.845121][T4126959] RAX: 0000000000000019 RBX: ffffb799cd0c9280 RCX:0000000000000018 [2570283.860872][T4126959] RDX: 0000000000000000 RSI:ffff96dd970ce000 RDI: 0000000000000005 [2570283.876525][T4126959] RBP:ffff96dd86f0a000 R08: ffff96dd970ce480 R09: 000000000000005f[2570283.892014][T4126959] R10: ffffb799cd0c9fff R11: ffffb799cd0c9000 R12:ffffb799cd0c94f8 [2570283.907406][T4126959] R13: ffffffffc11b1090 R14:ffff96dd970ce000 R15: ffffffffc11cd66c [2570283.922705][T4126959] FS:00007fa7723f8740(0000) GS:ffff96f51fac0000(0000) knlGS:0000000000000000[2570283.938848][T4126959] CS: 0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033[2570283.952524][T4126959] CR2: 00000000000000f8 CR3: 0000001a73e6e006 CR4:00000000007706e0 [2570283.967529][T4126959] DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1:0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000 [2570283.982400][T4126959] DR3:0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400[2570283.997308][T4126959] PKRU: 55555554 [2570284.007649][T4126959] CallTrace: [2570284.017598][T4126959] dev_ethtool+0x1832/0x2830 Fix this byadjusting efx->xdp_tx_queue_count after probing to reflect the true valueof initialized slots in efx->xdp_tx_queues.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
